item.title: How Arctic Soldiers Train for What They Fear Most: Warm Weather
item.description: The high north is dreaded for its bone-chilling winters. Even worse, say soldiers there, is the warmer season, when insects infest marshes that flood overnight.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Opinion | The Key to Ukraine’s Victory
item.description: ‘Is there a Manstein in Kyiv?’ isn’t the right question.

item.title: Opinion | How’s Life in That New Palestinian State?
item.description: What is its capital city? Can Christians and Jews freely practice their religion there?

item.title: Opinion | Why Qatar Changed Course on Hamas
item.description: Doha had operated with Israeli complicity, but a strike on Qatari soil changed the equation.
item.dc:creator: Amit Segal

item.title: Israel, Gaza Aid Flotilla Brace for a Confrontation at Sea
item.description: The Israeli navy is expected to intercept hundreds of pro-Palestinian activists off the coast of Gaza, an encounter that risks turning violent.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: China’s Communist Party Replaces Senior Diplomat
item.description: Liu Jianchao is the latest to be caught up in Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s disciplinary purges.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Britain’s Leader Promised to Defeat Populism. So Far, He’s Losing.
item.description: Keir Starmer was billed as a European litmus test for pragmatism over populism. After a year in office, he trails in the polls.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Ukrainian Diver Held in Poland Over Nord Stream Blast
item.description: German investigators tighten dragnet around Ukrainians accused of blowing up Russia’s undersea gas pipelines.
item.dc:creator: Bojan Pancevski

item.title: Trump Gives Hamas Ultimatum to Release Hostages or Face Destruction by Israel
item.description: In effect, the president threatened the prospect of more war in order to end nearly two years of fighting, in a risky diplomatic move delivered alongside Israel’s prime minister at the White House.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Trump’s Plan for Gaza Hands Netanyahu a Political Lifeline
item.description: After the prime minister agreed on terms to end the war, the onus falls on Israel’s Arab neighbors to make it happen. Until then, it can keep on fighting.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: French, German Inflation Picks Up Pace as ECB Looks Likely to Keep Rates in Place
item.description: Consumer prices rose 2.4% in Germany and 1.1% in France in September compared with the same month of last year.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Germany Jails Chinese Spy, Marking New Low in China-Europe Relations
item.description: The sentencing of the former assistant to a German far-right lawmaker casts fresh light on China’s spying efforts in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Tourists Are Flocking to a Chinese Megacity That’s Straight Out of Sci-Fi
item.description: Dizzying architecture, bright lights and a cyberpunk vibe have made Chongqing a must-see destination for Chinese and international tourists alike.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Opinion | The Trump Deal for Israel and Gaza
item.description: The pressure now shifts to Hamas to release all the hostages and disarm.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Flips the Global Script
item.description: His diplomatic moves on Ukraine and Gaza were both dazzling and unconventional.
item.dc:creator: Walter Russell Mead

item.title: Opinion | Time to Abandon ‘Active Defense’ in Ukraine
item.description: The doctrine proved to be ineffective after Vietnam, but better ideas came with Reagan’s military buildup.
item.dc:creator: Mark T. Kimmitt

item.title: Moldova’s Pro-Europe Party Claims Victory Over Russia-Backed Coalition
item.description: The parliamentary elections became a referendum on the pro-Europe party’s efforts to pull the former Soviet republic away from Moscow and closer to the West.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Russia’s Ambitious Plans in Africa Are Unraveling
item.description: Not long ago a rising military force in Africa, Russia is now struggling to maintain its footprint on the continent.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Taliban Release American Amid Talks With U.S. on Ties
item.description: The freeing of Amir Amiri came as the country is in broader economic and political talks with the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Massive Overnight Attack
item.description: More than 600 drones and dozens of missiles struck across the country while the U.N. General Assembly remained in session.
item.dc:creator: Ian Lovett

item.title: The Slow Demise of Russian Oil
item.description: The toll of the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine and Western sanctions has hastened the decline in Russian oil production.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Xi Is Chasing Huge Concession From Trump: Opposing Taiwan Independence
item.description: The Chinese leader views President Trump’s eagerness for a trade deal as an opportunity to press for his top goal.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Rwanda’s President Turns to Sport to Give Tarnished Image a Makeover
item.description: Paul Kagame hopes to bring Formula One to a country accused of using rebels to take critical minerals from its neighbors.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump Is Reasserting U.S. Dominion Over Latin America
item.description: A region the administration sees as the “U.S.’s backyard” is crucial to the president’s goals of reining in migration and stemming drug flows.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: China’s Anti-Japan Dramas Get a Gen Z Makeover
item.description: China’s latest anti-Japanese cultural productions are tweaking the formula to grab the attention of a younger generation.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: China Industrial Profit Rose Sharply in August
item.description: China’s industrial profit rose significantly in August, suggesting Beijing’s recent ramped-up drive to curb excess capacity and rein in cutthroat business competition is starting to bear fruit.

item.title: Iran’s President Defiant as Sanctions Set to Return
item.description: International sanctions suspended under the 2015 nuclear deal are expected to come back into force Sunday morning, squeezing the fragile Iranian economy.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Netanyahu Says Israel’s Critics ‘Caved’ to Pressure, as His Isolation Deepens
item.description: The prime minister spoke to a largely empty U.N. hall after a walkout by delegates, lashed out at the idea of a Palestinian state and vowed to keep fighting Hamas.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: China’s Premier Outlines Deeper Commitment to U.N.
item.description: The most senior-level Beijing official to address the General Assembly in a decade challenged tariffs and pledged a wider role.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Trump Told Zelensky He Was Open to Providing New Long-Range Weapons, Officials Say
item.description: In a discussion at the U.N. this week, Trump didn’t commit to ending restrictions his administration has had in place for months.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Trump Plan Backs Tony Blair as Postwar Gaza Leader
item.description: Under a White House plan that is being proposed to Arab and Israeli leaders, the former British prime minister would serve as interim administrator of Gaza, overseeing a body known as the Gaza International Transition Authority.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Suspected Russian Drone Incursions Expose Gaps in NATO Defenses
item.description: The alliance is rethinking how it responds to nontraditional threats after drones recently appeared in the skies over Poland and Denmark.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: The Path to the American Dream Is Narrowing for Indian Tech Workers
item.description: About 70% of H-1B visas go to Indians. Looming changes to the program are upending plans, but may help India retain talent.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Trump Confirms He Will Block Israel From Annexing West Bank
item.description: President Trump publicly reiterated a pledge he made privately to Arab leaders earlier this week, escalating pressure on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Europe’s Right-Wing Populists Swerve Left on the Economy
item.description: The adoption of a high-spending, pro-welfare and protectionist agenda has been key in winning over blue-collar workers.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Canada Orders Revamp at Postal Service, Sparking Sudden Strike by Workers
item.description: Workers at Canada’s state-owned postal service went on strike on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Chinese Premier Signals Desire for Stable U.S. Relations in New York Visit
item.description: Li Qiang, China’s No. 2-ranking official, urged U.S. executives to help maintain a fragile detente between Beijing and Washington.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Trump Open to Selling F-35s to Turkey, but Chides Erdogan for Buying Russian Oil
item.description: The president said sanctions blocking sales of American jet fighters could end on Thursday during a White House meeting with the Turkish leader.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: Canada Watchdog Projects Wider Deficits in Near Term Amid Tariff-Fueled Struggles
item.description: Canada’s budget deficit is projected to widen and surpass 2% of the economy for the current and coming fiscal years due to weak growth and spending measures planned by Prime Minister Mark Carney to rewire the economy, according to the country’s fiscal watchdog.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Sarkozy Gets Five-Year Prison Sentence in Gadhafi Funding Case
item.description: The former French president was convicted of conspiring to seek campaign funds from the regime of Libyan strongman Moammar Gadhafi.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: Why U.S.’s Trade Pact With South Korea Has Gotten Messier
item.description: The White House is looking to fine-tune the deal with Seoul after President Trump announced a $350 billion agreement in July.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Milei Fixed Half of Argentina’s Inflation Problem. He Needs Help With the Rest.
item.description: The country’s central bank no longer prints money to finance deficits, but a run on the currency could still cause prices to surge.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ip

item.title: China Urges Companies to Not Take Price-Cutting Playbook to U.S.
item.description: Chinese regulators have called on companies in recent months to rein in excessive competition and extreme discounting practices.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Qu

item.title: Every Nation Wants to Copy Iran’s Deadly Shahed Drone
item.description: Militaries around the world are seeking low-cost, easy-to-make ways to exhaust an enemy’s air defenses.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Bessent Says U.S. Is in Talks With Argentina for $20 Billion in Aid
item.description: It marks another example of President Trump rewarding loyalists and punishing critics in Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Jack Pitcher

item.title: Kim Jong Un Wants a Military That’s More Than Just Nukes—and Russia Can Help
item.description: The North Korean leader, taking lessons from his troops fighting in Ukraine, faces a tall task upgrading the nation’s Soviet-era conventional weaponry.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Kim Jong Un’s Proposition to Trump: Let’s Talk—but Not About Nukes
item.description: The North Korean leader’s offer to sit down with the president challenges a long-held U.S. policy of no dialogue unless disarmament is on the table.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: The Daring Caper of a Faithful Tibetan Who Outfoxed China
item.description: He escaped from police and crossed thousands of miles of wilderness on a decadelong odyssey toward freedom.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Citrin-Safadi

item.title: Putin In No Mood to Negotiate, U.K. Spy Chief Says
item.description: In a veiled message to President Trump, the departing head of MI6 warned that the Russian president has no intention of stopping his war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump, Starmer Paper Over Cracks Amid Royal Pageantry
item.description: The two leaders projected unity despite differences over Palestinian statehood, immigration and energy policy.
item.dc:creator: Tarini Parti

item.title: How Britain’s Keir Starmer Became Europe’s Soft-Spoken Trump Whisperer
item.description: The U.K. prime minister’s surprising rapport with the U.S. president offers a model other European leaders hope to emulate.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Alexei Navalny’s Wife Says There Is Fresh Evidence He Was Poisoned
item.description: Yulia Navalnaya said tests in two separate laboratories prove the former presidential candidate and Russian President Vladimir Putin’s main opponent was killed.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: A Visual Guide to Trump’s State Visit to the U.K.
item.description: The U.S. president is being granted one of the most elaborate state visits as Britain looks to cement its diplomatic ties with America.
item.dc:creator: Elizaveta Galkina

item.title: How the British Flag Became a Flashpoint in a New Culture War
item.description: A flag-flying campaign has morphed into a broader statement against a rise in immigration and sparked a debate on what the flags really mean.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Dangoor

item.title: Russia Hosts Surprise Guests at Its Wargames: U.S. Military Officers
item.description: The invitation came as President Trump is working to end the war in Ukraine and repair ties with Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: King Charles Rolls Out the Red Carpet to Woo Trump
item.description: With its military and economic power waning, Britain is leaning on its monarchy to keep the Trump administration sweet on the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Tarini Parti

item.title: Modi’s Strategy for Mending Ties With Trump: a Stiff Upper Lip
item.description: India’s prime minister has maintained a stoic silence in the face of sharp comments from Trump, while signaling he is eager to stay friends.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Kenya Uses U.S.-Funded Antiterrorism Courts for Political Crackdown
item.description: Young people who took to the streets to protest corruption and poor job prospects could face decades in maximum-security prison under a set of laws set up to combat al Qaeda.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: This Is the World’s Biggest Animal Migration—and Few Outsiders Have Seen It
item.description: Six million antelope storm through a pocket of Africa that’s nearly impossible to get to, but the Journal caught them on camera. “The entire planet should be amazed that this exists.”
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: U.N. Accuses Rwanda-Backed Rebels of Slaughtering Children, Other Civilians in Congo
item.description: M23 rebels in the Democratic Republic of Congo committed what might have been war crimes and crimes against humanity, raping women and executing children and other civilians, the United Nations said.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Putin Says Russia Will Strike Any Western Troops in Ukraine
item.description: The Russian leader’s comments came a day after European and U.S. officials met in Paris to discuss security guarantees for Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: The Black Market for Oil Blunts Trump’s India Tariffs
item.description: The extra levy meant to punish New Delhi for buying cheap Russian crude isn’t going as expected.
item.dc:creator: Carol Ryan

item.title: U.S. Tariffs on India Skirt Its Biggest Buyer of Russian Oil
item.description: Reliance Industries accounts for about a third of the Russian oil India imports.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: India Braces for the Pain of Trump’s Stiff Tariffs
item.description: Duties that just took effect will hit billions of dollars of trade and hurt Indian sectors ranging from textiles to farming.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
